title: Agent-Native Construction Layer
description: Apply agent-native principles to workflow construction. Provide parity, composability, and dynamic discovery for agents building workflows programmatically.

title: Tool Metadata Loading
description: Update list_tools() to read from tools/*/raw-tool.yaml, standardize Tool Manifest format

title: Test alignment: Add test_bus.py for drivers/bus.py
RAW v0.2.0 - Prompt-First Workflows
description: Transform RAW from code-first to prompt-first. Workflows designed through natural language, Claude generates code. Includes reusable tools system.

title: Implement interactive raw create command
description: Interactive workflow design through natural language. Claude asks for intent, suggests steps, confirms with user.

title: Implement tool system
description: Tools are reusable, versioned, tested components. Each tool has config.yaml, tool.py, test.py, README.md.

title: Implement raw generate command
description: Generate Python code from workflow descriptions. Creates tools if needed, generates run.py, test.py.

title: Implement raw dry-run with mock data
description: Auto-generate mock data for dry-run. Deferred to v0.3.0 - agents create mocks manually for now.

title: Implement raw publish command
description: Freeze workflow, pin tool versions, mark as published. Published workflows are immutable.

title: Implement raw dup command
description: Duplicate a workflow for modifications. Creates new draft from existing workflow.

title: Implement raw prime command for agent context injection
description: Output available tools and workflows in a format for agent consumption. Critical for agent-first design - allows Claude Code to discover available capabilities. Output should include: workflow list with status, tool list with descriptions, recent failures, quick command reference.

title: Create stock-analysis example workflow
description: Create complete example: yfinance to fetch TSLA data, pandas for indicators (RSI, MA), matplotlib for charts, save report to results/. Include run.py, dry_run.py with mocks, test.py, and README.md.

title: Create web-research example workflow
description: Create complete example: requests/httpx to fetch web content, extract and summarize text, save markdown report to results/. Include run.py, dry_run.py with mocks, test.py, and README.md.

title: Unified Tools Mechanism
description: Move from split raw_tools/ vs .raw/plugins/ to single tools/ directory with ToolRegistry. Enables remote tool discovery, installation, and management.

title: Create example workflow using @agent
description: Demo workflow showing sentiment analysis or classification using the new decorator

title: Implement to_ai_tool() utility
description: Convert RAW tool functions to PydanticAI tool definitions. Inspect signature, generate schema, wrap execution

title: Workflow validation with completion signals
description: Add WorkflowValidator.validate() returning ValidationResult(success, errors, suggestions). Provide explicit completion signals (.success(), .error(), .complete()) instead of relying on exit codes.

title: Extract command implementations from cli.py to src/raw/commands/
description: Move create, run, list, search, show, publish, serve, status, init, onboard, prime, and hooks function bodies from cli.py into individual command modules in src/raw/commands/. Each command gets its own file (e.g., create.py, run.py). Keep Click decorators in cli.py but delegate to command functions. This reduces cli.py from 821 lines and separates command logic from CLI parsing.

title: Replace custom @retry with tenacity
description: Refactor decorators.py to use tenacity library instead of custom retry implementation. Update all usages.

title: Test: Real-world scenario - API data pipeline
Test: Tool name sanitization edge cases
Test coverage: Add Tool Registry tests
Test: raw list workflows and tools
Integrate with @step tracking
description: Emit step events for @agent calls so they appear in manifest. Track LLM calls, tokens, latency

title: User: "Get weather for NYC and format as markdown report"
Add prompt caching for agentic steps
@agentic decorator implementation
description: Create raw_runtime/agentic.py with @agentic(prompt, model, max_tokens, temperature, cost_limit, cache) decorator. Inject LLM reasoning into workflow steps with prompt templating, context extraction, and type-safe response parsing.

title: User: "Fetch the latest Bitcoin price and save it to a file"
Cost tracking and limits for agentic steps
description: Add cost estimation before LLM calls, track actual costs per step, aggregate in WorkflowContext. Raise AgenticStepError if cost_limit exceeded. Log cost breakdown in manifest.

title: Extract raw-creator: creator agent and skills
Integration tests for agent-native features
description: End-to-end tests: agent builds workflow via SDK, runs it with @agentic steps, validates results. Test tool discovery, dynamic registration, cost tracking across full workflow execution.

title: User: "Send daily digest email with top Reddit posts"
Implement RemoteIndexRegistry
description: Fetch JSON index from GitHub, implement client-side caching

title: Create domain-specific packages in src/raw/
description: Reorganize src/raw/core/ into domain-specific packages: src/raw/engine/ (execution.py, server.py), src/raw/scaffold/ (init.py, templates/, markdown/), src/raw/discovery/ (search.py, workflow.py registry logic). This groups related functionality and makes the architecture more discoverable. The core/ directory currently mixes execution, scaffolding, and search concerns.

title: Auto-trigger dry-run after create --scaffold
description: When 'raw create --scaffold' completes, automatically run 'raw run --dry' to validate the generated scaffold works.

title: Response parsing with type hints
description: Parse LLM responses based on function return type. Support str, int, bool, Literal types, Pydantic models, list/dict. Handle parsing errors gracefully with clear error messages.

title: Setup monorepo structure with uv workspaces
Update test imports and verify runtime refactoring
description: Fix test imports in tests/ to reference new protocols/ and drivers/ structure. Run full pytest suite (157 tests) to verify no regressions from the refactoring. Fix any test failures related to import paths or module organization.

title: Test imports: Update protocol and driver imports
Unit tests for Python SDK
description: TDD approach: tests for create_workflow(), add_step(), validate(), completion signals. Mock filesystem and registry. Achieve 90%+ coverage for SDK module.

title: Implement raw install <name>
description: Resolve via Registry, add to raw.yaml dependencies, run GitToolFetcher

title: Refactor markdown generation to use templates and structured content
description:
Current markdown generation uses string concatenation (lines.append). Refactor to:

1. **Jinja2 templates** for structure (prime.md.j2, onboard.md.j2)
2. **Pydantic models** for content (PrimeContext, WorkflowSummary, ToolSummary)
3. **Markdown builder** utilities for tables, code blocks, lists
4. **Separate rendering from IO** - pure functions return strings
5. **Golden file tests** - snapshot tests for rendered output
6. **Input escaping** - handle pipes, backticks, special chars in user content

Files to refactor:
- src/raw/core/init.py (get_prime_content, get_onboard_content)
- Add src/raw/core/templates/ directory
- Add src/raw/core/markdown.py for builder utilities

title: Refactor init.py to use markdown module
Phase 5: HumanInterface Protocol
description: Create HumanInterface protocol to abstract human interaction channels (console, Slack, email). Replace tightly coupled approval logic. Methods: request_input, wait_for_response, send_notification. Implementations: ConsoleInterface, ServerInterface, RegistryInterface.

title: Phase 4: TelemetrySink Protocol
description: Create TelemetrySink protocol with log_metric, log_event. Implement ConsoleSink and JsonFileSink.

title: Consolidate runtime core public API
description: Update src/raw_runtime/__init__.py to expose main user-facing classes and functions. Ensure context.py and base.py import protocols from protocols/ directory. Clean up root raw_runtime by keeping only essential core modules (context, base, decorators, models, events, handlers, env, connection) and remove redundant code.

title: Testing & Documentation
description: Comprehensive tests for agent-native features, update documentation, and create examples demonstrating both construction and agentic steps.

title: Selective Agentic Steps
description: Add @agentic decorator for LLM-powered reasoning within workflows. Enable selective agent-in-loop for edge cases while maintaining deterministic execution.

title: Implement raw view command
description: Add 'raw view' command that spins up local HTTP server (http.server) serving HTML that reads .raw/logs/ and manifest.json. Auto-refresh as logs update. Simple embedded JS, no frameworks.

description: Create protocols/ directory under src/raw_runtime/ to house all Protocol definitions. This separates interfaces from implementations following clean architecture principles. Prepare directory with __init__.py for next phase.

Install pytest-asyncio for async runtime tests
Connected Workflow Architecture - Mothership Pattern
description: RAW workflows become server-aware when RAW_SERVER_URL is set. The server (raw serve) acts as a central registry and event router, enabling webhook-triggered approvals and external event handling. Consolidates raw view into raw serve as a unified dashboard.

title: Server-side: Run registry and event queue
description: Add RunRegistry class to manage connected runs. Add EventQueue for pending events per run. Implement endpoints: POST /runs/register, POST /runs/{id}/waiting, GET /runs/{id}/events, POST /runs/{id}/heartbeat, POST /runs/{id}/complete

title: Integration test: approval-demo with webhook
description: Create integration test: 1) Start raw serve, 2) Run approval-demo with RAW_SERVER_URL, 3) Approve via curl POST /approve/{run_id}/step, 4) Verify workflow completes successfully.

title: Documentation: Update ARCHITECTURE.md
description: Document the connected workflow architecture, local vs connected modes, server endpoints, and event flow. Update CLI reference for raw serve changes.

title: Server-side: Route approvals to event queue
description: Modify POST /approve/{run_id}/{step_name} to route decisions to pending_events queue instead of in-memory ApprovalRegistry. Connected workflows poll this queue.

title: Server-side: Stale run detection
description: Add background task to detect stale runs (no heartbeat for 60s). Mark as stale in registry. Clean up after configurable timeout.

title: Server-side: Dashboard UI
description: Add HTML dashboard at GET / showing: active runs with status, pending approvals with approve/reject buttons, recent completed runs, list of workflows. Replace raw view with this unified dashboard.

title: Client-side: ServerConnection class
description: Create src/raw_runtime/connection.py with ServerConnection class. Methods: connect(), mark_waiting(), poll_events(), wait_for_event(), complete(). Background heartbeat thread every 30s. Graceful fallback if server unreachable.

title: Client-side: BaseWorkflow integration
description: Modify BaseWorkflow.__init__ to check RAW_SERVER_URL, create ServerConnection, register on startup. Add cleanup in exit to call complete(). Print warning if server unreachable (falls back to local mode).

title: Client-side: Modify wait_for_approval for connected mode
description: Update wait_for_approval() to use ServerConnection.wait_for_event() when connected. Poll every 1s, timeout after 5 min (default). Fall back to console prompt in local mode.

title: Client-side: Add wait_for_webhook function
description: Add wait_for_webhook(step_name, timeout) function. Requires connected mode - raises RuntimeError with clear message if server unreachable. Returns webhook payload dict.

title: Remove raw view command
description: Remove the raw view command and viewer.py. Update CLI reference docs. raw serve dashboard replaces this functionality.

title: Add dynamic tool discovery and registry
Unify raw-cli: single CLI with bot/agent/create subcommands
Implement tool locking via SHA256 hash
description: Calculate SHA256 of all tool files. On 'raw publish', save hash in config.yaml. On 'raw run', warn if current hash doesn't match pinned hash. No tarballs needed.

description: Update init.py to create tools/ instead of raw_tools/, ensure tools/__init__.py is created

title: Import Path Resolution
description: Verify sys.path includes project root, ensure 'from tools.x import y' works

title: Add conditional step tracking (SKIPPED status)
description: Add concept of conditional branches in workflows. Steps defined but not run should be marked as SKIPPED in manifest. Add simple control mechanism for conditional execution.

title: raw-ai Package: Integrate PydanticAI for agentic workflows
description: Integrate PydanticAI for agentic workflows. Adds @agent decorator for LLM-powered steps with structured output, auto-converts RAW tools to PydanticAI tools, enables intelligent routing and decision-making in workflows.

title: Example workflows demonstrating new features
description: Create examples/: 1) agent-built-workflow.py (SDK usage), 2) edge-case-handler.py (@agentic for classification), 3) hybrid-workflow.py (deterministic + selective agentic steps).

title: Extract raw-core: protocols, events, errors, DI container
Production-ready state/data plane
description: Make RAW runs durable, resumable, and observable by upgrading the state/data plane (journaling, provenance, resume, indexing), borrowing the best ideas from Gas Town (durable work objects, explicit progress graphs) and Codex (append-only JSONL rollouts + typed item lifecycle events).
acceptance_criteria:
- Runs persist progress even if the process crashes
- A run can be resumed deterministically from persisted state
- Provenance (git/tool snapshot/config) is captured for each run
- Listing/querying runs is fast and stable
- Documentation and tests cover the new data plane

title: Add append-only run journal (events.jsonl)
description:
Persist run execution as an append-only JSONL event log under .raw/runs/{run_id}/events.jsonl, written incrementally as steps/tools/approvals happen (Codex rollout pattern). Make this the canonical source of truth for crash recovery.

Event protocol design:
- Define stable event schema with item lifecycle semantics (started/updated/completed) for steps, tool calls, approvals, and artifacts
- Events are versioned and backward compatible
- Each event has: timestamp, event_type, data payload
- Support parsing by external tools (dashboards, alerts)
acceptance_criteria:
- Each run creates `.raw/runs/{run_id}/events.jsonl`
- Events are flushed during execution (not only at finalize)
- Event schema is versioned and documented
- Journal captures at least: run started, step started/completed/failed/skipped, artifacts, approvals

title: Docs + migration notes for new data plane
description: Update RAW documentation to describe the run journal, resume semantics, provenance, indexing, and work orders. No backward-compat/migration guarantees required.
acceptance_criteria:
- docs/ARCHITECTURE.md and docs/GUIDE.md cover journaling + resume
- CLI help/docs include new commands and flags
- Design explicitly states that older run formats may not be supported

title: Derive manifest from journal (event reducer)
description: Implement a reducer that folds `.raw/runs/{run_id}/events.jsonl` into the canonical `manifest.json` (and any other summary views). This makes manifests rebuildable and enables post-crash reconciliation.
acceptance_criteria:
- `manifest.json` can be rebuilt solely from `events.jsonl`
- Reducer supports the current journal schema only (no backward compatibility required)
- Corrupt/partial trailing lines are handled safely
- Unit tests cover reducer behavior

title: Add run reconciliation for crashes/stale runs
description: On startup or via a `raw doctor`/`raw reconcile` command, detect runs that started but never reached a terminal status and mark them appropriately using the run journal (e.g., crashed, cancelled). Provide safe recovery guidance.
acceptance_criteria:
- Stale/incomplete runs are detectable from on-disk state
- Reconciliation never deletes data
- Terminal status is written back as journal events (and reflected in derived manifest)
- Unit tests cover common crash/restart scenarios

title: Implement raw resume for interrupted runs
description:
Add raw resume <run_id>|--last to continue an interrupted workflow run using persisted journal state.

Simple approach: Resume from last completed step
- Skip completed steps, rerun from the first incomplete/failed step
- Do NOT support mid-step resumption (that's complex, defer for v2)
- Resumed run links to prior run_id for provenance
- Idempotence: Steps should be designed to be rerunnable (user responsibility)
acceptance_criteria:
- `raw resume` resumes from last completed/committed step
- Resuming does not rerun completed steps unless explicitly requested
- A resumed run records linkage to the prior run (provenance)
- Integration tests cover: crash mid-step, crash between steps, manual cancellation

title: Add work orders (convoy-like) to track outcomes across runs
description: Introduce a durable WorkOrder/Order object (Gas Town convoy analogue) that represents a user outcome across multiple runs/iterations. Store under `.raw/orders/` and link intent â†’ workflow_id(s) â†’ run_id(s) â†’ artifacts â†’ final status.
acceptance_criteria:
- `raw order create` creates an order with intent and optional workflow selection
- Each `raw run` can attach to an order
- `raw order show` surfaces latest status, linked runs, and primary artifacts
- Order format is stable and versioned

title: Record provenance at run start (git, tools, config)
description: Capture and persist provenance for every run: git SHA/branch/dirty, workflow version, tool snapshot hashes, config knobs (providers/keys redacted), and environment details. Write as the first journal event and include in derived manifests.
acceptance_criteria:
- Provenance is recorded for every run, even if the run fails early
- Provenance is stored in a stable, queryable structure
- Secrets are never persisted
- `raw show` surfaces provenance succinctly

title: Add content-addressed artifact store (blobs)
description: Store large artifacts in a content-addressed store (e.g., `.raw/blobs/<sha256>`) and reference them from runs/orders. Enables dedupe across retries/iterations and improves provenance.
acceptance_criteria:
- Artifacts can be stored and retrieved via content hash
- Manifests reference artifacts by hash + logical filename
- Garbage collection strategy is defined (retain by reachability from runs/orders)
- Tests cover dedupe and retrieval

title: Add run index for fast list/show/query
description: Maintain a small index over runs (e.g., `.raw/runs/index.jsonl` or sqlite) to support fast `raw list/status/show` without scanning all run directories. Include stable pagination (cursor) similar to Codex rollout listing.
acceptance_criteria:
- `raw list`/`raw status` are fast with many runs
- Index updates are crash-safe (append-only or transactional)
- Cursor-based pagination is supported
- Index is rebuildable from run journals

title: Standardize runtime event protocol (item lifecycle)
description: Define a stable event schema for RAW run-time signals with item lifecycle semantics (started/updated/completed) for steps, tool calls, approvals, and artifacts (Codex-style). Ensure `raw run` and `raw serve` can consume the same stream.
acceptance_criteria:
- Event schema is versioned and documented
- Console handler and server handler consume the same event stream
- Events are emitted for: steps, approvals, artifacts, tool calls
- Tests validate event emission ordering and completeness

title: Create integration-twilio: voice and SMS handling
User: "Scrape job listings from a careers page and export to CSV"
Differentiate dry run execution from normal run
description:
In execution.py, run_workflow() treats dry_run.py and run.py identically. Consider adding:

1. Add timeout limits for dry runs (they should be fast with mock data)
2. Validate mocks/ directory exists before running dry_run.py

NOTE: Do NOT use environment variables for this. The run mode is determined by which script is executed (run.py vs dry_run.py), not by env vars. Env vars should be reserved for secrets/credentials.

Location: src/raw/core/execution.py:102

title: Move implementation classes to drivers/ subdirectory
description: Move concrete implementations to drivers/: FileSystemStorage, MemoryStorage -> drivers/storage.py; EnvVarSecretProvider, DotEnvSecretProvider, ChainedSecretProvider, CachingSecretProvider -> drivers/secrets.py; LocalOrchestrator, HttpOrchestrator -> drivers/orchestrator.py; ConsoleSink, JsonFileSink, MemorySink, NullSink, CompositeSink -> drivers/telemetry.py; LocalEventBus, AsyncEventBus, NullEventBus -> drivers/bus.py; ConsoleApprovalHandler, AutoApprovalHandler -> drivers/approval.py. Leave protocols in original files temporarily for backward compatibility.
